1.text: Behold, a king shall reign for justice, and for chiefs they shall rule for judgment.

2.text: And a man was as a hiding of the spirit, and a covering of the tempest; as brooks of water in Zion, as the shadow of a weighty rock in a weary land.

3.text: And the eyes of those seeing shall not be blinded, and the ears of those hearing shall attend.

4.text: And the heart of the hasty shall understand to know, and the tongue of those stammering shall hasten to speak plain.

5.text: Liberal shall no more be called to the foolish, and noble shall not be said to the deceiver.

6.text: For the foolish will speak folly, and his heart will do vanity to do profaneness and to speak error to Jehovah, to empty the soul of the hungry; and he will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

7.text: And the implements of the deceiver are evil: he will meditate counsels to destroy the humble with words of falsehood, and in the needyâ€™s speaking judgments.

8.text: And the liberal will counsel liberal things, and upon liberal things shall he stand.

9.text: Rise up, ye careless women; hear my voice, ye confident daughters; give ear to my word.

10.text: Days over a year shall ye being confident, be disturbed; for the vintage being finished, the ingathering shall not come.

11.text: Tremble, ye careless be disturbed, ye, confident: strip and be naked, gird upon the loins.

12.text: Smiting upon the breasts for the fields of desire, for the fruitful vine.

13.text: Upon the land of my people shall come up the thorn of the sharp point; so upon the houses of rejoicing of the exulting city.

14.text: For the fortress was left, the multitude of the city was forsaken; the hill and the watch-tower for caves even forever; the rejoicing of the wild asses a pasture of the flocks;

15.text: Until the spirit shall be poured upon us from on high, and the desert be for Carmel, and Carmel be reckoned for a forest.

16.text: And judgment dwelling in the desert, and justice shall sit in Carmel.

17.text: And the work of justice was peace, and the service of justice, rest and confidence, even to forever.

18.text: And my people shall sit in a dwelling of peace, and in habitations of trust and in quiet resting places.

19.text: And the hail hailing upon the forest; and the city shall be made low in lowness.

20.text: Happy ye sowing upon all waters, sending the foot of the ox and the ass.
